# GitHub Repository About & Profile Setup Guide

## Repository About Section

### Short Description
```
X.509 Certificate Management Library and CLI for Go
```

### Full Description (if using longer form)
```
A performant and optimized Go library for generating, validating, and managing X.509 certificates, 
Certificate Authorities (CAs), and related cryptographic operations. Includes CLI tool with support 
for RSA, ECDSA, Ed25519, CRL management, OCSP, and certificate validation.
```

### Website URL
```
https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/0x524a/certifier
```
(Or your project website if you have one)

### Topics (Tags)
Add these 8 topics for discoverability:
- `go`
- `golang`
- `certificates`
- `x509`
- `cryptography`
- `certificate-authority`
- `cli-tool`
- `pki`

**Why these topics:**
- `go`, `golang` - Makes it discoverable in Go community
- `certificates`, `x509` - Core functionality keywords
- `cryptography` - Security/crypto developers find it
- `certificate-authority` - CA-specific searches
- `cli-tool` - For those looking for CLI tools
- `pki` - Public Key Infrastructure searchers

## Social Preview (Open Graph)

**What it shows:**
- Used when sharing the repo link on Twitter, LinkedIn, Slack, etc.
- Default shows your repo name and GitHub logo
- Custom image recommended for better engagement

**Recommended custom image specs:**
- Size: 1200Ã—630 pixels
- Format: PNG or JPG
- Include: Logo, project name, brief tagline
- Avoid: Too much text, cluttered design

**Image Suggestions:**
- Show the Go logo + Certifier branding
- Include key features: Certificate, Security, CLI
- Use professional colors (blue/green/gray)

**Example tagline for image:**
```
CERTIFIER
X.509 Certificate Management for Go
Generate â€¢ Validate â€¢ Manage
```

## Sidebar Customization (Right Side of Repo)

### About Card Setup

**File Structure:**
The About card automatically shows:
1. Description (from "About" section)
2. Homepage link
3. Topics/Tags
4. License badge
5. Release information
6. Language stats
7. Sponsors (if enabled)

### Sponsors Section

**Enable GitHub Sponsors:**
1. Go to Settings â†’ Sponsor
2. Create/link sponsorship account
3. Add tiers and benefits
4. Update `.github/FUNDING.yml`

**Current FUNDING.yml:**
```yaml
# github: [0x524a]  # Uncomment if using GitHub Sponsors
# patreon: # Username
# ko_fi: # Username
# custom: ['https://your-donate-link.com']
```

## README Badges (First Section)

Your README should display badges showing:

```markdown
[![Go Version](https://img.shields.io/github/go-mod/go-version/0x524a/certifier)](https://go.dev/)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/0x524a/certifier)](LICENSE)
[![Go Report Card](https://goreportcard.com/badge/github.com/0x524a/certifier)](https://goreportcard.com/report/github.com/0x524a/certifier)
[![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/0x524a/certifier/branch/main/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/0x524a/certifier)
[![CI](https://github.com/0x524a/certifier/actions/workflows/lint.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/0x524a/certifier/actions)
[![Release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/0x524a/certifier)](https://github.com/0x524a/certifier/releases)
[![GoDoc](https://godoc.org/github.com/0x524a/certifier?status.svg)](https://godoc.org/github.com/0x524a/certifier)
```

**What each badge shows:**
- Go Version: Minimum required Go version
- License: MIT/Apache/etc
- Go Report Card: Code quality score
- codecov: Test coverage percentage
- CI: Build/test status
- Release: Latest version
- GoDoc: API documentation availability

## Engagement Features

### Pin Repositories (Your Profile)

Pin 3-6 most important repos:
1. **certifier** - Main project (pin this)
2. Other notable projects

**Benefits:**
- Shows up at top of profile
- Increases visibility
- Highlights your best work

### Star Your Own Repo

Not recommended, but you can:
- Star similar projects for visibility
- Follow other certificate/crypto projects
- Contribute to related projects

## SEO & Discoverability

### Keywords for README

Include naturally in documentation:
- X.509 certificates
- Certificate Authority (CA)
- Certificate Signing Requests (CSR)
- Go/Golang
- Cryptography
- PKI (Public Key Infrastructure)
- TLS/SSL
- Key management
- CRL (Certificate Revocation List)
- OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol)

### Link Building

Good to link to:
- Go documentation
- Standard library crypto packages
- Related projects
- Your personal website/blog

**Best practices:**
- âœ… Use descriptive commit messages
- âœ… Tag releases with semantic versioning
- âœ… Write comprehensive README
- âœ… Add topics/tags (8 recommended)
- âœ… Keep documentation updated
- âœ… Regular activity (commits, releases)
